data.event: Founded in 1820, Columbia served as a major trading center for communities throughout the Wiregrass Region of Alabama between 1822-1833, which coincided as its time as Henry County seat.

event.title: lost the county seat status to Abbeville in 1833

data.event: It lost the county seat status to Abbeville in 1833.
The town was incorporated on April 29, 1880 and was the center of education, culture, commerce, and trade.

event.title: received its first cotton textile mill in 1891

data.event: Columbia received its first cotton textile mill in 1891 and its first electric plant in 1892.
A branch of the Henry County Courthouse was located here from 1889 until Columbia became part of Houston County in 1903.

event.title: became part of Houston County in 1903

data.event: A branch of the Henry County Courthouse was located here from 1889 until Columbia became part of Houston County in 1903.
Columbia got electric street lights in 1900 and its first electric utility company in 1914.
